newsitem.title: CHINA: China says leading dissident in "normal" health.
newsitem.headline: China says leading dissident in "normal" health.

text.p: A Chinese official said on Saturday that Wei Jingsheng was in normal health in prison and accused the man regarded as a father of China's pro-democracy movement of attacking a fellow inmate, the Xinhua news agency said.
"Wei's health in prison is in normal condition," Xinhua quoted the official of the Ministry of Justice as saying.
"Reports that 'Wei was beaten up in prison' and 'Wei did not receive medical care for his illness' are sheer fabrications by certain individuals," Xinhua quoted the official as saying.
Wei, who is serving a 14-year jail term for subversion, had beaten up a fellow inmate but had admitted his mistake and would not be punished, the official said.
"Considering Wei Jingsheng's improved attitude toward his mistake, the prison authorities decided not to give him any penalty," the official said.
A family member said prison authorities had punished Wei for the fight by shutting off electricity to his cell and banning him from shopping at the prison canteen.
